column4: hmmm what is the command for terminal (I want to make a shortcut)
Depends on the terminal you use.
Open a term, if it has a help menu, click "About" to see what it is.
the filename has spaces... so the command gets broken or something
Quotes or escape the space with a \.
Or mv file\ with\ spaces file_no_spaces
You really should have a breeze through a small bash tutorial. It may be more useful than you give credit.
Yeah, just after 15 years of windows, I need to get used to terminal.
It's understandable, I'm just saying you maybe shouldn't brush off something as useful as becoming comfortable with bash as 'unimportant'.
